requirements: No knowledge of calculus required. Enrollment limited to students who have not previously taken a high school or college calculus course.
description:
The use of mathematics to address real-world problems. Applications of exponential functions to compound interest and population growth; geometric series in mortgage payments, amortization of loans, present value of money, and drug doses and blood levels; basic probability, Bayes's rule, and false positives in drug testing; elements of logic.
No knowledge of calculus required. Enrollment limited to students who have not previously taken a high school or college calculus course.
title: Mathematics in the Real World
